intro: Pusaetha spicata, commonly known as the spike heath, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It typically blooms in the spring and early summer, producing white or pale pink blooms. Pusaetha spicata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
